author: migamake
title: Sign documents with smart contracts
description: Precisamos de uma maneira fácil de colocar documentos legais, e contratos inteligentes básicos em Cardano sem código.

f6_assessments.q0: Proposal partially answers the aim of this fund. Digital legal documents and basic smart contract, ready-to-go solutions on Cardano without coding knowledge needed are important. However, the description doesn't state how it responses to poor countries' needs, to those who are on the start of their digital journey.
f6_assessments.q1: The team is vaguely described - we hear general attributes but it's not confirmed with LinkedIn profiles or other proofs. It would be way better if the proposer estimates hours needed for particular development phases and counted in as XXX$ per hour instead of general amount. Sample: User forum - 3k$. Is it going to be developed from scratch? Or will you use phpBB or similar? Then does the deployment require 3k$ work? Or deployment is close to free and you count it's moderation etc.?
f6_assessments.q2: Auditability is prepared in a very basic level. It's hard to tell whether we could follow particular steps of the project over the time. I wish they had more detailed roadmap which would make it easier to confirm if something got done or not.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal seeks to solve the problem of how to store legal documents by storing legal documents and smart contract descriptions on Cardano blockchain which partially aligns with the challenge goals but is not a foundational registry solution listed in the challenge.  
The proposal does a good job of articulating how the solution scales to address future challenges
The proposal could be improved by a better description of the problem to solve, articulating the value to Cardano ecosystem, providing key metrics and goals that more closely align with the challenge and either selecting another challenge (Miscellaneous) or more closely aligning with this challenge's goals.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal articulates the feasibility aspects of budget is broken down and reasonable (descriptions of several budget items are not clear), realistic timetable and plan (could be formatted better for clarity), and detailed technical explanation of the solution.
The proposal's feasibility could be improved by evidence of experience (linkedin profile), team composition (skills required), and a challenges and risks section.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal includes a detailed description of the solution that addresses the problem.
To improve the proposal include a roadmap, milestones, time horizon (success criteria is hopeful deliverable statements), metrics/KPIs to measure proposal success, and a clear understandable description of the targeted problem (the problem statement provided is a description of the intended solution and not why it needs to be done).

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is addressing the core challenge of enabling contract domain experts to use blockchain smart contracts in a smooth manner. This is a critical area and therefore it can be said the proposal is addressing the core challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The team including the proposer Michał Gajda has experience in the development and assuming the support of https://www.migamake.com and the team behind the company it is likely that the proposal will be implemented. The website list more than 10 adequately qualified people in the domain required to implement the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has a detained whitepaper, However, the process of translating contract paper in English to the smart contract is technically involved and needs technical peer review to evaluate the validity.  The proposal is innovative and the implementation details are quite exhaustive. The progress is highly auditable.

f6_assessments.q0: Relation to personal qualifications: Due to both my past political engagement and having lived in different countries with different approaches to administration on a governmental level, I have experienced, discussed and thought about this topic a lot. In addition to this, I have an understanding of budgeting, both due to my past engagement as a treasurer in a political organisation and my current work as a project engineer, which will give me a good grasp of realistic budgeting of projects. The proposal identifies a problem within the challenge which needs to be solved and provides an interesting, comprehensible solution that will add value to the ecosystem and meets most of the challenges KPIs. The only thing I don't understand here is why the plan is to use Ethereum-based smart contracts. The proposal can be, if made up correctly, scalable.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposers are transparent about their background and seem competent and up to the task.  It is likely they are up to the challenge.  The proposers have a realistic expectation of the the type and number of team members required to implement the proposal.
The budget is outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items.
No plan is provided for the case that additional funding is required to implement the proposal.
The proposal offers a realistic timetable to complete the work.
The proposal provides a sensible and conductible plan for implementation that shows not only what is being done but also how. The attached document also explains something about the technical background, which makes this more credible.The plan describes the resources necessary to implement the proposal.
The proposer has not considered challenges and risks that might occur during implementation.
f6_assessments.q2:
A roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement is provided. Metrics and KPIs that define the success of the proposal are presented.
A Clear understandable description of the targeted problem is provided and a good, comprehensive solution that addresses the problem comes along with it. I'm confident this proposal can be audited well.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal effectively addresses the challenge by "Dapp proposals should cover foundational Registry solutions, namely:

National ID & Civil Registry, Property Registration, Medical & Vaccination, Education Census, Revenue Service, Business Incorporations, Elections Voting, Customs & Border Control, Criminal Records, Employment Census, Vehicle Registration, Licensing & Certifications."

Blockchain-based contract database and execution support is in line with the intent.
f6_assessments.q1: The technical plan is sound, the budget is reasonable, the milestones are achievable.
f6_assessments.q2:
the community will be able to audit the following: "1. After 3 months we hope to provide MVP for the compiler and implement at least one example contract.
2. After 6-9 months we hope to have a working IDE with the compiler."

f6_assessments.q0: Great idea. I would like to know how the proposal plan to integrate different legal traditions within different jurisdictions. This is overall a brilliant idea
f6_assessments.q1: The team has a good experience. It would have also been useful to have included some Linkedin profile links as well. The compiler has a detailed strategy and practical deliverables. I think this is achievable.
f6_assessments.q2: Great budget details. How the definition of success is unclear. I would be glad if that is made clear. Also to the team should commit to transparency by detailing how their activities would be documented and made open.

f6_assessments.q0: The ease of smart contracts is a great idea that can contribute to the Cardano universe, however the connection with the challenge in which the proposal was presented is not clear. Although the bureaucracy is mentioned, there is no development of this aspect that allows making the link with the challenge. So if we have an identified problem, there is an articulation with the Cardano universe, but it is not adequately aligned with the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The proponent presents the team that will be used for the proposal but in general, more references and links are required to know who is part of the team. It is observed from the work that the proponent knows the issue and has clearly identified the number of team members who will work on the proposal. I observe as adequate the budget structure which describes the resources that they consider necessary to implement the proposal. However I consider that the budget is high. There is no verifiable plan in case more funds are required. The proposal does describe and explain technical aspects such as architecture, language and technologies.
f6_assessments.q2: There is a roadmap with the milestones and the horizon, however the budget that is presented necessarily requires more elaborate work in this regard. Therefore, more in-depth work should be done on the metrics that will define the success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
This project targets using smart contract to manage any legal document workflow, by translating smart contracts into conventional English language. The deliverables are translator codes, an interface web server, and smart contract templates example that will generate English text to describe contract behaviour. 
This project has the potential to facilitate user analyze of smart contracts, which in principle can foster Cardano's Dapp adoption. But the description of the problem and its solution is broad, which make it difficult to assess how large its impact can be on Cardano's Dapp.
Based on the information included in the proposal, I agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The ambition of this proposal is broad, as it addresses many various types of smartcontracts. The team claims to gather programming and blockchain skills, and also expert of law and legal document management. Unfortunately, I cannot confirm this statement based on the information included in the proposal because teammembers are not identified and the proposal does not include evidence supporting this skills (like public profile or previous development).
The description of the solution, translator code and templates, is at the concept stage. I would recommend for a further application that the proposal also includes a description of the challenges to be taken and a risk mitigation plan. This would help voters to have a better view of the feasibility of the project
I neither agree or disagree that this proposal is likely to be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
A detailed budget breakdown is provided linking each budget line to a deliverable. It offers a way for the community to assess the progress of the project. 
A 4 steps roadmap is provided, but it is not easy to the link roadmap steps with deliverables and timelime. As all deliverables will most likely not be developed at the same time, I would recommend to the proposer to clarify the roadmap by including time marks, and precising what will be delivered at each step.

solution: Queremos carregar documentos convencionais em Cardano e construir um contrato inteligente básico em torno deles.
experience: Nossa equipe é composta por 3 desenvolvedores e 4 revisores especializados no domínio do mgmt de documentos, direito, linguagens de programação e cadeia de bloqueios.
